node.title: Create mouse_from_analog.lua
node.body:
Background:
In some cases like Apple touchpads or inside VMs, mice input is not recognized properly, this hook turns an analog device into a mouse signal. Adapt to your needs.

Usage:
arcan -H hooks/mouse_from_analog.lua <appl>

I assign any copyright I may have for this changes to letoram.

Provenance: 
https://chat.openai.com/share/60c5f152-dd21-41db-9abc-7de49b8363a6

node.title: ODY-334  Iputに単位をつける、ODY-335  インストールアイコンの位置修正
node.body:
# 事前確認(共通)

- [x] PR 前に動作確認をしたか
- [x] ビルドエラー/ESLint エラーは起きていないか

- [x] 機密情報を含んでいないか
- [x] 最新の`develop`ブランチを反映しているか

# レビュー優先度（どれか一つ）

- フッター追加
- アプリインストールコンポーネントの位置変更

# やらないこと<!-- このプルリクエストでやってもおかしくないけどやらなかったことを書く -->

特になし

node.bodyText: 編集ボタン押した時にカーソルが当たるように処理追加

input以外をクリックしたときに編集モードをリセットし、単位が挿入されるようにする処理
covertValueToDisplayTextで編集モードの場合も単位がつくようにしようとしたが、処理がうまくいかないのと、あまり入力時に単位がなくても困らないので、この案を採用している

コメントした！
確認お願い🙏

そういえばフッター入れるのすっかり忘れてたね😅　
ありがとう👍
メイン画面の方が、フッターの高さの分だけ縦スクロールできるようになっちゃってるみたいだから、その分だけメインコンポーネントの高さを削ってもらいたい🙏

src/utils/formatting.tsとするやり方に関する参考情報
https://chat.openai.com/share/a9452ad4-6b33-40a9-9e73-6d85fd5bd8fc
外だしした
修正した
LGTM! 🌾

node.bodyText:
Amazingggg work on this, Kelsey!! Reading through this makes me super excited about getting this in front of students. It's gonna be really cool to see the various ways that folx will utilize this tool.
I left a few suggestions; nothing major jumped out at me. Thank you so much!

The last sentence was a bit difficult for me to parse the first time reading it. What do you think of this small change?
  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            - There are legal considerations if we use AI tools for public work or businesses. Many tools have been trained on massive data sets with text, art and other works scraped from the internet without legal clearance. Unless a tool has been built solely with data that has been given permission to be used for training and generation, it may not be legal to use the art or text generated by an AI tool verbatim. 
          
          
            
            - There are legal considerations if we use AI tools for public work or businesses. Many tools have been trained on massive data sets with text, art and other works scraped from the internet without legal clearance. Using the art or text generated by an AI tool verbatim may be legally restricted unless the tool has been exclusively constructed with data that has been authorized for training and generation.

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            1. Our first step is to visit [chat.openai.com](chat.openai.com) and press the "Sign Up" button to start creating an account. 
          
          
            
            1. Our first step is to visit [chat.openai.com](https://chat.openai.com) and press the "Sign Up" button to start creating an account.

            5. You can log in with your new account at [chat.openai.com](https://chat.openai.com) once your email is verified. The first time you log in, you'll be asked to enter your first name, last name, and birth date to verify your age.

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            8. At this point you should be redirected a brand new chat page! We should see "ChatGPT 3.5" at the top, letting us know we are working with OpenAI's 3.5 model. 
          
          
            
            8. At this point you should be redirected to a brand new chat page! We should see "ChatGPT 3.5" at the top, letting us know we are working with OpenAI's 3.5 model.

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            The first number indicates how many versions of the response there are, and the second number is which version of the response we are currently viewing. The arrows are buttons that let us navigate forwards and backwards through the responses so we can see all of the versions.
          
          
            
            The second number indicates how many versions of the response there are, and the first number is which version of the response we are currently viewing. The arrows are buttons that let us navigate forwards and backwards through the responses so we can see all of the versions.

I was a bit lost reading this section because I wasn't entirely sure what the prompt to Chat was - is it literally the list of feedback with no other context?

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            When doing our own searching, we also need to be asking ourselves if the sources we’re using to verify information are trustworthy. Anyone can publish anything on the internet, but there are frameworks we can use to ask ourselves questions about a website or source to help us investigate if it may be worthwhile. Once such framework is the SMART Check:

That's exactly what's happening, the prompt is literally just the feedback. Would it be helpful to include a sentence before we show the example around "a prompt can be just data without instructions"?

Edit: I added the line as a suggestion on the PR so it's easier to see/review.
I'm thinking above the feedback when introducing the example, we could start the paragraph with something like:

We're going to look at a prompt that's different from others we've seen – this time we're not going to include any direct instructions on what the generative AI should do. Let's say that we moderate a forum...

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Let's say that we moderate a forum and want to categorize feedback from our users. We're going start from a zero-shot prompt and iterate on it until we have a few-shot prompt. For our example, we have a list of feedback like:
          
          
            
            We're going to look at a prompt that's different from others we've seen – this time we're not going to include any instructions telling the generative AI what it should do. Let's say that we moderate a forum and want to categorize feedback from our users. We're going start from a zero-shot prompt and iterate on it until we have a few-shot prompt. For our example, we have a list of feedback like:

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            If we include no examples, no instructions, and simply submit our list of feedback as a prompt, generative AI tools like ChatGPT will still try to provide a helpful response, likely about how to address these pieces of user feedback. 
          
          
            
            If we include no examples, no instructions, and submit our list of feedback itself as the prompt, generative AI tools like ChatGPT will still try to provide a helpful response, likely about how to address these pieces of user feedback.

node.title: improve documentation Readme
node.body:
Thanks to https://chat.openai.com/share/51b5e459-6956-4591-b8a9-beeae0401063

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **Documentation**
	- Updated README to reflect new product name, "Instructor", and its features.
	- Added "Get Started in Moments" section for installation guidance.
	- Introduced "How Instructor Enhances Your Workflow" section to highlight key enhancements.
	- Removed "Quick Start" section and relocated "Contributing" section to the end of the document.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

README.md (3)


1-4: The introduction is clear and concise, providing a good overview of the project.


17-42: The badges and the introductory paragraph provide useful information about the project. The "Get Started in Moments" section is straightforward and easy to follow. The "How Instructor Enhances Your Workflow" section clearly explains the benefits of using Instructor.


222-228: The "Contributing" section is clear and encourages community participation. The link to the issues marked as good-first-issue or help-wanted is a good way to guide potential contributors.

The "Step 1: Patch the client" section provides clear instructions on how to get started with the Instructor. However, it would be helpful to explain what patching the client does in a bit more detail for users who are not familiar with the concept.

1-3: The introduction is clear and concise, providing a good overview of the product and its capabilities. The use of markdown for emphasis is appropriate.

Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the maintainers why we should accept this pull request.

This text will be included in the changelog. If applicable, include links to documentation or pieces of code.
If your change includes breaking changes please add a code block documenting the breaking change:

```
BREAKING CHANGES: This patch changes the behavior of configuration item `foo` to do bar. To keep the existing
behavior please do baz.
```
-->

## Related Issue or Design Document

<!--
If this pull request

1. is a fix for a known bug, link the issue where the bug was reported in the format of `#1234`;
2. is a fix for a previously unknown bug, explain the bug and how to reproduce it in this pull request;
3. implements a new feature, link the issue containing the design document in the format of `#1234`;
4. improves the documentation, no issue reference is required.

Pull requests introducing new features, which do not have a design document linked are more likely to be rejected and take on average 2-8 weeks longer to
get merged.

You can discuss changes with maintainers either in the Github Discussions in this repository or
join the [Ory Chat](https://www.ory.sh/chat).
-->

Put an `x` in the boxes that apply. You can also fill these out after creating the PR. If you're unsure about any of
them, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! This is simply a reminder of what we are going to look for before merging your code.
-->

- [ ] I have read the [contributing guidelines](../blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and signed the CLA.
- [ ] I have referenced an issue containing the design document if my change introduces a new feature.
- [ ] I have read the [security policy](../security/policy).

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion by explaining why you chose the solution
you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...
-->

node.bodyText: Added a melos command for custom_lint!
Added missing dispose in tests.
Added a dummy test as the test would fail without any test files.
This is a test file for Custom Lint Rule. Referenced riverpod_lint tests from https://github.com/rrousselGit/riverpod/tree/master/packages/riverpod_lint_flutter_test.
I'm starting to think that naming it flutterfire_adapter_lint might be better than fluttefire_lints, as the latter could be mistaken for a lint package of FlutterFire itself. What do you think?🧐

Hmmm, I'm stumped. I guess it's correct that it's adpter that's the target.
If it's flutterfire_lint, it feels like a linter on using FlutterFire itself directly 🧐.

How about alt(ive) + fire(base) for altfire_lints?
with an alternate meaning for alt.
Maybe the plural would be better since we have multiple lint rules?
https://chat.openai.com/share/a979e3fb-f3fc-4216-bd93-7b6265b32a46

Thank you for the suggestion!
I like the idea of using altfire_lints. I'll make the change!
Thanks for the rename too!

There will need to be an ALLOWLIST of Apache2 compatible software licenses.
GPLv3 is not compatible with Apache2.
GPL'd code
GPL'd code

node.title: Embedding similarity uses closeness max function
node.body:
* **What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (Bug fix, feature, docs update, ...)
Bug fix

* **What is the current behavior?** (You can also link to an open issue here)
In structured index schema rank profile, tensor search similarity uses SUM (+) on embedding closeness per field, instead of MAX.

* **What is the new behavior (if this is a feature change)?**
Similarity is now calculated with MAX. Uses binary max tree since max function is only a binary function.
`test_structured_vespa_schema` and `test_structured_vespa_index` tests are now fixed by adding vector count field to test schemas.

* **Does this PR introduce a breaking change?** (What changes might users need to make in their application due to this PR?)
no

* **Have unit tests been run against this PR?** (Has there also been any additional testing?)
yes

* **Related Python client changes** (link commit/PR here)


* **Related documentation changes** (link commit/PR here)


* **Other information**:


* **Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements**
- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines
- x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes/features)
- [] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

node.bodyText: This doesn't read well?
I'm assuming max won't accept one argument? e.g., max(value1)? Because if it did, you would only need one base case
Though this is still better. We don't know if an unnecessary max is going to cause inefficiency, even if it is mathematically inconsequential

I would argue that you don't need these tests.  You can add full schema tests like the ones you fixed above to cover these cases if you find these necessary. As a rule of thumb, we don't write unit tests for private methods -- we only test the public interface. If you find it impossible to get good coverage without unit-testing private methods, then chances are your design isn't cohesive (which is not the case, your design is fine here). Check this out also https://chat.openai.com/share/d6c43184-1ad5-49b5-b209-e659bdb68c33
Yep according to documentation, max is for 2 arguments: https://docs.vespa.ai/en/reference/ranking-expressions.html#max-x
Got this, I'll note this for future private methods. That being said, should I just keep them in since I already wrote them? Or would you prefer them removed?
I would argue though that it's cumbersome to make 5 full new schemas just to test the output of 5 different cases of _generate_max_similarity_expression. It seems like a lot of wasted space.

node.title: Feat Containerize the application to improve cross OS compatibility
node.body:
🚀 **PR Summary:**
Adds a Dockerfile to support containerization as part of https://github.com/OthersideAI/self-operating-computer/issues/36.

🛠️ **Changes Made:**
- Included Dockerfile for containerization.
- Used Python:3.11-slim as the base image (Considering it's lightweight and supports all libs).

🔍 **Testing:**
- Tested successful build and execution using the Dockerfile.

👩‍💻 **Next Steps:**
- Review and merge if no issues arise.

🔧 **How to Build and Run:**
1. **Build the Docker Image:**
   ```bash
   
   docker build -t your_image_name .

2. **Run the Docker Image:**
   ```bash
   
   docker run -it your_image_name

node.title: [backend] Add access level and password to Room model
node.body:
まずはbackendでprivate/protected/publicなどのアクセスレベルに関するロジックを実装していきます。

## モデルについて少し考えてまとめたもの
https://usatie.notion.site/Public-Private-Protected-channel-5b21d8a3dc2348f09b0d1c5d9d3176ba?pvs=4

## 実装したもの
RoomとUserOnRoomに関する以下それぞれのエンドポイントを、テストと一緒に実装した。
- `PATCH /room/:id/:userId` (Update Role)
- `DELETE /room/:roomId/kick/:userId` (Kick User)
- `DELETE /room/:roomId/leave` (Leave Room)
- `DELETE /room/:roomId` (Delete Room)
- `PATCH /room/:roomId` (Update Room)
- `GET /room` (Get Rooms)
- `POST /room/:roomId/invite/:userId` (Invite User)
- `POST /room/:id` (Enter Room)
- `GET /room/:id` (Get Room)
- `POST /rooms` (Create Room)

## 迷ったポイント
### 高階関数とRef<T>による共通化を少しやりすぎている気がする
  - そのせいで読みにくかったりメンテしづらかったりしそうという
  - 同じコードを何度も書くことに耐えきれず多少無茶して共通化している
### 入室・招待と退室・キックのAPIについてはREST的に考えれば統一的に扱うこともできるのですが、エンドポイントを分割している
分割した方が認証と認可のロジックを非常にシンプルに保つことができる。最初は分割せずに書いてたのですが、テストも実装も結構大変で。。。一応GPTに相談してた時のログはこちら
https://chat.openai.com/share/176a2982-bf5e-4bbe-8d06-74e4c96a5ba5

#### 分割しない場合
入室・招待（POST /room/:roomId/:userId）
退室・キック（DELETE /room/:roomId/:userId）

#### 分割する場合
入室（POST /room/:roomId/）
招待（POST /room/:roomId/invite/:userId）
退室（DELETE /room/:roomId/leave）
キック（DELETE /room/:roomId/kick/:userId）

## 今後のTODO案
1. Ownerが退室する場合の処理（Owner以外で最初に入室したAdminがownerになる、いなければMember、誰もいなければRoom削除）
2. ownershipのtransferに関するendpoint作る
3. 1つのRoomに1人のOwnerしか存在できないように、Room.ownerIdを持たせる
4. passwordを直接保存するのではなく、hashを保存する

## 実装予定
以下のような順番で実装していく予定。

1. Prismaのschemaを変更 :white_check_mark:
5. 既存のビルド、Unitテスト、E2Eテストが通るように修正 :white_check_mark:
6. Privateに関するテストとロジックを実装（GET/GET/POST/PATCH） :white_check_mark:
7. Protectedに関するテストとロジックを実装（GET/GET/POST/PATCH） :white_check_mark:

node.bodyText: The error handling for findUniqueOrThrow is specific and correctly rethrows unexpected errors. However, the error code 'P2025' is Prisma-specific and should be documented or abstracted for maintainability.
Modifying the request object directly to add admin is not a best practice as it can lead to unexpected side effects. It would be better to use a more formal method of passing data.
There should be a check to ensure that the room exists after attempting to find it with findRoom. If the room does not exist, an appropriate exception should be thrown.
That error is handled globally

commit分かれててめちゃめちゃ見やすいです。分かれてなかったら、絶対レビューしないですww
別のコメントでもしたのですが、PRを分割にする方に向かうのもアリかと思いました。
自動生成のコードはむしろコミット分けてもよいかもです！これ記事に書かなかったんですけど、別にコミット感で必ずしもテストが通る必要は無いっていうのは言ってました。
migration fileまとめちゃったほうが良い？
分からないですが、access level追加する変更とRoomEntity使う変更はcommit分けても良いのかと思ったり (fdc02b3 )
これはcommit名とは全く違う変更かと思ったり ( 0cd08c2 )

[backend] Implement POST /rooms endpoint
- Fix create room dto validation

これ、コミットメッセージだと思うんですけど、
このPR > Implement POST /rooms endpoint > Fix create room dto validation
って感じに3つのコンテキストがあるような気がしたりします（これはContextの分割レベルの話なので間違ってるって訳では無いのですが）
自分だったら、とりあえずPR1つでやることをもっと減らします。例えば、テストのリファクタとaccess levelの追加とか。
それで、Implement POST /rooms endpointか Add access level in roomみたいなタイトルのPRに対して、Fix create room dto validation がコミットメッセージになって、body消す感じですかね。
これは、http statusみたいな感じなんですか？うーん、これだけだとなんだか分からないです😅

すみません、このロジックやschemaの確認というのは具体的にどこの範囲のことを言ってますか・・・？
parameterが数字であることのバリデーションとかだとすると、僕もそうしたいんですが（通常はParseIntPipeとかでやるのですが）、どうやらPipeの前にGuardが呼ばれてしまうようなので不要なErrorを避けるためにこのロジックを持つ必要があるような気がしており。。。
（公式ドキュメントでは無いのですがRequestの処理される順番について）
https://ru-nestjs-docs.netlify.app/faq/request-lifecycle

In general, the request lifecycle looks like the following:

Incoming request
Globally bound middleware
Module bound middleware
Global guards
Controller guards
Route guards
Global interceptors (pre-controller)
Controller interceptors (pre-controller)
Route interceptors (pre-controller)
Global pipes
Controller pipes
Route pipes
Route parameter pipes
Controller (method handler)
Service (if exists)
Route interceptor (post-request)
Controller interceptor (post-request)
Global interceptor (post-request)
Exception filters (route, then controller, then global)
Server response

Introduced a Ref class for holding mutable references. Ensure that the usage of mutable references is necessary and that there's no simpler alternative that could be used, such as directly assigning the values to variables within the scope they are used.

Adding a NOT NULL column without a default value to an existing table will fail if the table is not empty. Consider adding a default value or a migration strategy for existing rows.
- ALTER TABLE "Room" ADD COLUMN "accessLevel" "AccessLevel" NOT NULL,
+ ALTER TABLE "Room" ADD COLUMN "accessLevel" "AccessLevel" NOT NULL DEFAULT 'PUBLIC',
Or, if the intention is to selectively set the value for existing rows, a separate migration step should be included to handle this before setting the column to NOT NULL.

Guardはcontrollerのhandlerとは別の場所ですが、もっと後で行うべきという意味ですかね。

確かにcontorllerではないですね。失礼。
もっと後で行うべきというよりかは、guardにあるべきでは無いかなって感じでした。
guardにあるべきではないと思う理由は

データの整合性を保つためのロジックが色々な場所に散らばる
再利用性が悪い（別のAPIで、そのAPIのメインの処理とは別にroomのupdateをしたい時に、guardは使えない？）

Interface (web) is responsible for decoding the input, convert values to proper types, then invoke a business (core) function, and finally render the result in the expected format (html, json, ...)

+authentication/authorizaton

通話で話したこと

web interface (Controller)は入出力のvalidationだけをすべき
DBへのアクセスが含まれているようなvalidationロジックはservice側で実行した方がいい
現状、UpdateRoomGuardなどは再利用は考えていないので、再利用に関しては考慮しない
Ensure that the canActivate method properly handles the case where user or params might be undefined to prevent runtime errors.
